title: Sejuani has 55.06% winrate with 75.77% ban rate, while Amumu has 54.53% win rate with 0.63% ban rate
body: By no means I'm stating that Sejuani isn't strong, but c'mon, isn't Sejuani a bit overated? I mean, Amumu has nearly her winrate and the differene on the banrate is abysmal. It's more than 74% difference. Not to mention that many are starting to give priority to Gragas over Sejuani due better clears.

replies.body:
logic doesn't work around here.

this is gameplay&balance we are talking about.

here we just ask for Sona buffs and complain about Veigars rework.

Hold on guy.

We also demand nerfs. Get your facts straight.
NERF ZED!!!

I feel as though ban rate tends to be less about win rate and more about perceived counterplay.

Sure Amumu wins about as much as Sej, but it feels as though there is a lot more you can do against an Amumu who is winning to avoid dying to him.  His gap closer requires landing a skillshot and his AoE stun is localized to the area around him.  Sej's gapcloser is free target and she can throw her CC at you (and let's be real here it's more on her to miss that thing than it is on you to dodge it).

When I lose to a Sejuani I tend to come out of that game thinking there wasn't much I could have done to beat her.  BAN
When I lose to an Amumu I may think he's too strong but in the back of my mind I'm running over all the times I could have dodged the Q to shut down his mobility or spread better for the ult.
https://awesomecommentphotos.files.wordpress.com/2013/08/554992_1404951159723363_2009883807_n.jpg?w=670
upvote for goat
Upgoat?
Updog?
Whats updog?

> [{quoted}](name=gypsylord,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rW1FABmu,comment-id=0024,timestamp=2015-04-21T06:48:58.479+0000)
>
or spread better for the ult.

Did anyone else read this as spread butter?

> [{quoted}](name=gypsylord,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rW1FABmu,comment-id=0024,timestamp=2015-04-21T06:48:58.479+0000)
>
> I feel as though ban rate tends to be less about win rate and more about perceived counterplay.
> 
> Sure Amumu wins about as much as Sej, but it feels as though there is a lot more you can do against an Amumu who is winning to avoid dying to him.  His gap closer requires landing a skillshot and his AoE stun is localized to the area around him.  Sej's gapcloser is free target and she can throw her CC at you (and let's be real here it's more on her to miss that thing than it is on you to dodge it).
> 
> When I lose to a Sejuani I tend to come out of that game thinking there wasn't much I could have done to beat her.  BAN
> When I lose to an Amumu I may think he's too strong but in the back of my mind I'm running over all the times I could have dodged the Q to shut down his mobility or spread better for the ult.

It is INCREDIBLY easy to counter jungle Sejuani.  She is weak early and it's very, very easy to abuse this.

I also don't understand your reasoning here.  You say that you run over all the times you could have dodged Amumu's Q but not Sejuani's?  If Sej doesn't hit you with her Q she's very easily kited, same as Amumu, unless she wants to ult you, which is sometimes quite good because it means she's not ulting your entire team.  

Also, you realise spreading works against both of those ults, right?  Almost the exact same counterplay exists for both of those champions.

LOL not even close. Amumu needs to be close, Sej doesn't this makes a HUGE difference. Yes spreading works against both, but with Sej you typically need to get your adc right out of the way, while your front liners keep sej back (though she can barge passed) amumu on the other hand, it's easier to surround him, bait out his ulimate or box him out from your carries. Because of this, even though both are "similar" it is much harder to stop sej then it is to stop amumu. Also, counter jungling comes down to the jungler. The ones banning will only be jungle like what, 1/5 times (in higher elos probably more), so they just know sej wrecks their lane, not whether they can counter jungle.

Put simply, in laning phase, sej ganks can be so much more painful, and she has more "approach" options because of her free dash, plus she can slow without wasting her ultimate. Amumu uses his ultimate, people immediately say "amumu's ulti is down" so he isn't much of a threat for a minute or so, his gank speed is just slower and more dependant on the ultimate.

In team fights like I said, Amumu can be boxed out, I've seen one try to tunnel down an adc, land his ulimate, only to see he has no HP left by the time he gets there. Sej doesn't need to get as close, and gets there easier, making her more dangerous a champ when played by people who are not as good with her

You do realize that Sejuani is no faster than Amumu and her Q is shorter range.  Yes she can use it over walls even without a target while Amumu's Q has to hit a target to pull him over a wall, but the idea that Sej is a better ganker is a bit absurd.  I have more success with Amumu than I do with Sej.  You hit Amumu's Q even at level 3 and it usually means a dead ADC or Midlaner.  I've Q'd in as Sej and ended up focused and dropped in bot lane as the knock up doesn't last long and usually the other team will focus before the W can start dealing damage.  With Amumu you can turn on his W before hitting Q and the damage starts the instant the Q lands.

Amumu can reach a lane faster (like if he goes bot or top) but in reality, if you need the max range of Q, then it's a risky gank to begin with, and I've played against amumu, and easily protect the ADC from his ganks, then tank my way to the turret. But Sej on the other hand can slow you and the adc, meaning if she times her ganks better (not just zip lining from an easy distance) escaping is SO much harder without flash, and she can save the knock-up to secure, not initiate. Like with leona, I often use zenith blade, then let my adc hit theirs while i walk towards enemy turrets. If the enemy adc tries to fight back, I can stun, and W kicks in, if they try to run, I can still stun, unless they flash, then they burn flash and play safe for the rest of the time.

Amumu can make single super plays, but sej is more consistently reliable and therefore harder to play AGAINST. I am not down on amumu, I ban him still in some cases, but he is easier to box out than sej, not because of speed, but just general presence. AOE slow makes big difference, anytime free dash makes big difference, and I believe the CD is shorter too than amumu's Q. Because I have been ganked by amumu, still killed the enemy adc and escaped, or had him dive, and we both die (adc double kill), whereas Sej rarely ends up dying under turret like amumu does a lot, and protects adc as well as attacks, amumu only attacks.

ALso, amumu's kit is designed to work better if you fight back (like taric for example) AOE that cd faster if he's in combat, AOE % dmg, short range melee. If you ignore him, you take less damage from him, sej does not have that weakness, if you ignore her you are still taking her max damage and greater cc.

AGAIN I respect amumu, but sej is harder to play AGAINST not saying who is stronger, just who is harder to counter.

To be honest, I have a harder time against amumu when I am mid (no ulti's included) but cause I am squishy as fuck and if he lands that stun you're dead. But bot has a support, and top has more time to see him coming and therefore escape - forcing him to use his stun early, and often you escape. (unless opponent intelligently forces an engage and locks your attention away from him)

Sej's slow means that once she closes the distance on a top laner, the losing opponent can get involved easier, (worse if they were winning) so it depends a bit on lane too

When I play mid and enemy uses sej, I rarely worry at all, unless she ulti's me, which nothing i can do there but hope to flash escape, I can just keep vauge awareness of her location. But amumu when you're playing mid keeps you on your toes
So true, as Amumu I love ganking the mid lane because its usually so easy.  Sejuani can't do it unless you catch the midlaner being hyper aggressive.

> [{quoted}](name=Catsnthings,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rW1FABmu,comment-id=00240000,timestamp=2015-04-21T09:08:07.875+0000)
>
> It is INCREDIBLY easy to counter jungle Sejuani.  She is weak early and it's very, very easy to abuse this.
> 
> I also don't understand your reasoning here.  You say that you run over all the times you could have dodged Amumu's Q but not Sejuani's?  If Sej doesn't hit you with her Q she's very easily kited, same as Amumu, unless she wants to ult you, which is sometimes quite good because it means she's not ulting your entire team.  
> 
> Also, you realise spreading works against both of those ults, right?  Almost the exact same counterplay exists for both of those champions.

Good point, also Amumu can usually win a duel with any other melee champ thanks to his E which reduces physical damage and has a reduced cooldown when he takes damage.  Sejuani is almost purely a CC production machine while Amumu can get in and do AOE % health damage with his W since it continues to deal out damage as long as he has mana and can stay close to you.   (Sejuani's % health damage is a single target before the AOE damage kicks in.)
I do want to point out that sejuani's ult worse than amumu's if you have a good frontline. A single tank (And good wards), will prevent her from ever landing more than maybe a 2 man stun.

> [{quoted}](name=Cameron2325,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rW1FABmu,comment-id=00240006,timestamp=2015-04-21T19:09:24.901+0000)
>
> I do want to point out that sejuani's ult worse than amumu's if you have a good frontline. A single tank (And good wards), will prevent her from ever landing more than maybe a 2 man stun.

And that won't work against Amumu?
I want you to go look at their kits on a wiki page or something lmao

Dodging Amumu's Q. 

Ever.

Ha.

Sej's gapcloser is free target and she can throw her CC at you (and let's be real here it's more on her to miss that thing than it is on you to dodge it).

r u working on any chmpyuns?

Exact same as what yas was.

Just yas had a 45% win rate and the highest ban rate until rito finally decided to cut his tendons after a year of using them.

I just hope they don't take a year like they did with yasuo to fix this counterplay problem, But I also hope they don't 'compensate' her like veigar. No champion deserves that.

Low ban/pick rates and high win rates usually come from the fact that the people actually playing them are good at it. 

High pick rates mess up the view of win rates because there is a wider variety playing the champion. 

While Amumu may have a similar win rate. He's mainly being played by those who have mastered him compared to sej. This is why Brand, for example, always has a good win rate despite being a weaker pick in general. When the champion is played mostly by those who are past the learning curve of the champion, that champion will have a higher win rate than the average champion.

> [{quoted}](name=Cindikle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rW1FABmu,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-04-20T21:10:58.729+0000)
>
> Low ban/pick rates and high win rates usually come from the fact that the people actually playing them are good at it. 
> 
> High pick rates mess up the view of win rates because there is a wider variety playing the champion. 
> 
> While Amumu may have a similar win rate. He's mainly being played by those who have mastered him compared to sej. This is why Brand, for example, always has a good win rate despite being a weaker pick in general. When the champion is played mostly by those who are past the learning curve of the champion, that champion will have a higher win rate than the average champion.

Amumu's pick-rate is higher than Sejuani's...

Sejuani = 10%
Amumu = 14%
That's mainly because of the ban rate. Comparing that 10% to how many games she can be picked, it's in theory a 40% pick rate.

> [{quoted}](name=Cindikle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rW1FABmu,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2015-04-20T22:22:37.712+0000)
>
> That's mainly because of the ban rate. Comparing that 10% to how many games she can be picked, it's in theory a 40% pick rate.

No... that is wrong.

Back when Sejuani was barely ever banned, her pick rate hovered around 2% to 3%. Her sudden increase in popularity is because she became quite strong due to the new items and meta changing which happened recently.

You say that her pick rate is lower than Amumu's because of her high 75% ban rate, but that simply isn't the case because her pick rate was WAY LOWER than it is now back when her ban rate was around 0%.

http://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/stats/sejuani

http://puu.sh/hl67m.png

> [{quoted}](name=Cindikle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rW1FABmu,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2015-04-20T22:22:37.712+0000)
>
> That's mainly because of the ban rate. Comparing that 10% to how many games she can be picked, it's in theory a 40% pick rate.

Her pick rate was actually around 10% in ranked even before her ban rate went up.

Meaning someone who would of picked her isn't getting to. I don't think there's a realistic chance that every sej ban isn't banning out the people who play her. Without a 75% ban, her pick rate would have to at minimum double. Even more so the more she's played in the LCS.

> [{quoted}](name=Cindikle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rW1FABmu,comment-id=00040000000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-20T23:10:31.450+0000)
>
> Meaning someone who would of picked her isn't getting to. I don't think there's a realistic chance that every sej ban isn't banning out the people who play her. Without a 75% ban, her pick rate would have to at minimum double. Even more so the more she's played in the LCS.

I'll just move my replies over to where you're discussing this with Sir Yamazuki, since Yamazuki and I seem to be telling you the exact same thing.

Your claim...

> Without a 75% ban, her pick rate would have to at minimum double

...Is incorrect. Look here again. Notice how that when her ban rate was around 0%, her pick rate was 2% to 3%.

http://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/stats/sejuani

http://puu.sh/hl67m.png

> [{quoted}](name=Cindikle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rW1FABmu,comment-id=00040000000000010000,timestamp=2015-04-20T23:11:20.512+0000)
>
> Amumu has always had a larger fan following as well as more dedicated players. That's why he has such a strong win rate. 
> 
> Sej's popularity wasn't instant.

It is true that Amumu has always been more popular, but I don't see what this has to do with anything.

Also, Sejuani's popularity WAS instant, and you can clearly see that from the graphs where her popularity and ban rate both increased at the same time while her win rate also overall increased as well.

There is a reason why her popularity, ban rate, and win rate all rose at the same time. The reason for this is because of the meta shift favoring tanks due to Cinderhulk.

Only problem I see with this is Amumu does not have a low pick rate.  According to LoLKing, he's the 17th most picked champion at the moment, at 14.06% pick rate.  I don't think that he's a solo queue balanced champ, but he's also not good competitive, so any nerfs on him are just going to get stupid uproar.

Amumu seriously used to be unplayable in ranked because he got banned so much, but I guess those days are gone.
{{item:3070}} {{champion:32}} {{item:3070}}
Yep, early S3. Malph and Amumu banned every game.

Her winrate might be higher if it weren't for the ban rate.

But ban rate isn't just about who's OP or not, it's who players are frustrated playing against. Look at Katarina's ban rate, it's been consistent for awhile along with her winrate. OP or not, people just don't like playing against her.

That's because bans aren't for OP champions.
Bans are for champions that are **popular** and strong.
Sejuani gets played in LCS so she gets popular.
Amumu doesn't, so he doesn't get picked and thus get banned.
No one wants to be friends with ammumu though....

Banrates are usually a combination of "how frustrating is this thing" and "how strong is this thing", rather than being solely about how strong or "overrated" something is.

It's like how LeBlanc and Nidalee have relatively high banrates when you consider their respective winrates - people just don't like playing against that shit.

I think part of that might be the fact that Amumu is also a powerful counter to a few champions. When you see the enemy picking Nautilus/Thresh/Blitzcrank/Darius or some combo of the above, you know that you can pick Amumu and destroy them when they try to use a pull to initiate a teamfight. 

Amumu is a very old champion that a lot of players have serious veteran experience on. his ban rate will be lower than hers because the cinderhulk is much more obvious of a buff on her. "percent bonus hp! sej is broken!"

In reality, Amumu is probably far stronger than she is because sunfire cape was his first and most important item as a jungler and now it's been combined into a jungle sword and made even more powerful. I honestly think he gets more out of it than she does.
He doesn't benefit from the HP as much though.  Sej gets damage from HP, Amumu is just tankier.  I would say that they benefit evenly.
Jinx 54 percent win rate with 33 percent pick rate.

half of the sej bans are from peer pressure, noobs saying "ban sej", "wtf no sej ban?"

its not worth he grief so most captains just ban it for that reason alone.

Amumu is not even half as mobile as Sejuani, has much weaker pre-6 ganks and doesn't stop spell casts with his ult. It is much easier to shut down Amumu than it is to shut down Sejuani. For one, Amumu getting caught by Lee Sin or J4 in his own jungle means instant death while Sejuani can just Q over a wall.

I can out play amumu by dodging his bandage toss and ult. 
Even if I dodge sejs ult she can straight up 1v1 most fighers or adc by running along side them until they get aoed down.
They are both pretty strong but that is why I ban sej if I ban her
Amumu is less fun, Sejuani's dash isn't targeted.  Thats why there's such a difference in popularity.
Amumu isn't fun? C'mon man...
Sej is now too mainstream. People should play Amumu while he is still indie, and then when everyone else realizes he is op, complain that you liked him before he was cool. You am become hipster now.

Sejuani is just much more reliable and easy to play. Amumu has to land his Q or flash in order to stun with his ult. Sejuani can throw her's a decent distance to stun you and she doesn't have to land a thin skill shot to gap close. 

Easy to play champions will have a higher pick rate. Higher pick rates mean higher ban rates.

the fact that she is super poplar, everybody players her, and still maintains the HIGHEST winrate says a lot. compare that to malzahar, heimerdinger, skarner - few play them, but excel when they do.when a champion has one of the highest ban rates, the highest pickrates of junglers champions, and one of the highest winrates, i wouldnt say "overrated". 

you cant compare winrates and banrates. the highest ban in the past month is katarina, who has the 10th highest pick but a 45% winrate @ 47th place. why do people ban her? because it only takes 1 under-preforming midlaner to completely wreak your team. compare that to sejuani, who has almost as high a banrate, a higher pickrate, and one of the highest winrates. 

compared to amumu, she provides more AOE CC (AOE-capable knockup and AOE-capable slow versus just a single-target stun), does only slighty less damage, has slighty weaker initiation (duration-wise), but stronger initiation (enemies cant cast spells while locked). She doesnt have quite the range, but makes up for it by using her Q to escape and E to kite. she also isnt as mana hungry. her ganks also dont rely on a single-target skillshot, so its easy to hit with a flash. pre-6 if that skillshot does hit, she can follow it up with a slow. amumu cant.

sejuani doesn't have to be right on top of you to ult and is an actual stun
sejuani has free to use mobility that doubles as CC thats easier to land than Amu Q
sejuani has everything amumu has and more

Sej might be overstated, that's hard to say.  The problem with the information that you have here is that a lot of people consider Amumu a pubstomper and otherwise utter trash.  Even if people think Amumu is too strong, they're under a lot of pressure not to ban him.
